Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: Canadian Human Rights Act (CHRA) sections 10 and 11
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged wage discrimination against Air Canada
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Commission's decision
Evidence_Requirement: Evidence of procedural unfairness or jurisdictional overreach
Institutional_Action: Investigation conducted using third-party consultant (Kapel and Associates Inc.)
Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Statutory authority to delegate investigative responsibilities
Evidence_Type: Procedural record, opportunity to respond, investigation report
Complaint_Issues: Delegation of investigative duties, procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Discrimination: Gender-based wage discrimination (implied by CHRA sections 10 and 11)
Protected_Group: Employees potentially affected by wage discrimination
Legal_Standard: Statutory authority and procedural fairness under administrative law
Protection_Claim: Right to fair investigation under CHRA
State_Protection_Assessment: Adequate, as Commission acted within authority
Credibility: No finding of lack of credibility
Targeted_Group: Air Canada employees represented by CUPE
State_Protection_Adequacy: Adequate, no denial of procedural fairness
Claimant_Status: Trade union acting on behalf of employees
Legal_Basis: Violation of CHRA provisions on wage discrimination
Victim_Basis: Employees subject to potential wage disparity
